channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Financial Sector Cyberattacks Doubled in 2025, Fueled by Geopolitical Hacktivism
item.description:
A new report from Check Point Software reveals a dramatic escalation in cyber threats targeting the global financial sector, with incidents more than doubling in 2025. The primary driver was a 105% increase in Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks, which were largely motivated by geopolitical...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Everest Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Japanese Manufacturer Hosokawa Micron
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Hosokawa Micron Corporation, a leading Japanese manufacturer of industrial processing technology. The group announced the breach on an underground forum, threatening to publish approximately 30 GB of exfiltrated confid...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese APT 'Amaranth-Dragon' Hits Southeast Asian Governments with WinRAR Exploit
item.description:
A newly identified China-linked APT group, dubbed 'Amaranth-Dragon,' is conducting targeted cyber espionage campaigns against government and law enforcement agencies in Southeast Asia. The group, believed to be affiliated with the broader APT41 ecosystem, is exploiting a known WinRAR vulnerability (...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

item.title: 'Shadow Campaign' Hacks Governments in 37 Countries, China-Linked Group Suspected
item.description:
Security researchers have uncovered a massive, long-running cyber-espionage operation dubbed 'Shadow Campaign.' The campaign is attributed to a suspected Chinese nation-state group, TGR-STA-1030, and has successfully compromised at least 70 government and critical infrastructure organizations in 37 ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: SolarWinds Discloses Five Critical RCE & Auth Bypass Flaws in Web Help Desk
item.description:
SolarWinds has disclosed a set of five critical vulnerabilities in its Web Help Desk (WHD) platform, a tool used by over 300,000 organizations. The flaws include two unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities and two authentication bypasses, each with a CVSS score of 9.8. This incid...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Claims Breach of Tulsa International Airport, Leaks Data
item.description:
The Russian-affiliated Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Tulsa International Airport. The group has listed the airport on its data leak site, alleging the theft of sensitive data including financial records and employee information. While airport operations ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Canada Computers Discloses Data Breach Affecting Guest Checkout Customers
item.description:
Canada Computers Inc., a major Canadian electronics retailer, has announced a data breach that exposed the personal and credit card information of customers. The incident affected individuals who used the 'guest' checkout feature on the company's website between December 29, 2025, and January 22, 20...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attack Cripples City of New Britain, CT, Forcing Manual Operations
item.description:
A ransomware attack has caused significant and ongoing disruption to the municipal network systems of New Britain, Connecticut. The attack, which began last week and was later confirmed as ransomware, has impacted the city's entire internet server. As a result, city departments have been forced to a...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Incident Response

item.title: Automated Attacks Wipe Exposed MongoDB Databases, Demanding $500 Ransom
item.description:
An automated data extortion campaign is actively targeting publicly exposed and misconfigured MongoDB databases. A threat actor is systematically wiping data from these unsecured servers and leaving a ransom note demanding approximately $500 in Bitcoin for its return. Research from Flare identified ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: CRITICAL: Ivanti Patches Two Actively Exploited RCE Zero-Days in EPMM
item.description:
Ivanti has released urgent security patches for two critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities, CVE-2026-1281 and CVE-2026-1340, affecting its Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) solution, formerly MobileIron Core. Both flaws are rated 9.8 out of 10 on the CVSS scale and are confirmed to be act...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack
